plugins.name: Duplicate Master Component
plugins.description:
This is a simple plugin that lets you select one or more components and/or component sets and duplicate them as new master components/component sets, preserving their properties. This plugin makes up for a basic missing feature in Figma‚Äîwhen you copy/paste or duplicate a master component, it creates an instance of that component. When creating a design system, it's often useful to actually duplicate a component as another master component, for example, to create another button based on a previously made button. Using this plugin, you can do this very easily, instead of having to create an instance, detach the instance, and then re-create all of the properties.


This version of the plugin is dead simple and consists entirely of a single action, with no UI. In later versions I plan to add an optional UI that allows users to select which properties of selected components they would like to preserve during duplication, create multiple duplicates, and perhaps some other features like configurable names and naming templates for duplicated components. :).

accepted.name: Avana Vana
accepted.description:
Senior Product Designer & Full-stack Developer

Currently Design Lead at Co:Create (www.cocreate.ink)

plugins.tagline: Duplicate master components and component sets instantly, preserving their properties.

plugins.name: Metro
plugins.description:
Welcome to Metro for Figma

- your go-to plugin for seamless navigation and organization within your Figma projects. Whether you're a solo designer or part of a larger team, Metro is here to turn your design process into a smooth, intuitive journey.


Key Features:


  • üí° Frame Link Management: Easily create, manage, and visualize sets of linked frames. It‚Äôs like having a visual map of your project's structure at your fingertips.
  • üó∫Ô∏è Effortless Frame Navigation: Navigate across different pages and frames with ease. Metro connects your design elements, making it simple to jump between related frames, no matter where they are in your project.
  • üåü Auto-Scroll to Linked Frames: Metro smartly identifies your selected frames on the canvas and auto-scrolls to their linked set in the plugin, saving you time and clicks.

plugins.name: Attributed Text Copy Helper
plugins.description:
The plugin is used to easily copy attributed text just by selecting text node.
Default use case:
When developing applications in XCode, it's fast just to copy text from design viewer and paste attributed string into storyboard/xib's UILabel/UITextField `attributedText` field.

So, how it works:
0. Start Plugin
1. Select TextNode in side navigator or on canvas
That's it, now you have attributed text from TextNode copied into your clipboard! Paste it into editors, what support that and enjoy!

plugins.name: Koobiq Sizing Tokens for Spectral
plugins.description:
Elevate your design workflow with Koobiq Design System. Seamlessly integrated with the Spectral plugin, the plugin transforms raw pixel measurements into intuitive design token names, such as XS, S, and M. This enhancement simplifies communication between designers and developers, allowing for clearer, more efficient collaboration.


How it Works: Run the plugin effortlessly, and it automatically identifies and converts numerical values within text layers named "number" into designated token names. Whether you select specific layers or apply the plugin to an entire page without selection, the plugin streamlines the process, making it easier than ever to create specs tailored to the Koobiq Design System.


Key Features:

  • Automatic conversion of pixel values to sizing tokens (e.g., 8px ‚Üí XS, 16px ‚Üí S, 24px ‚Üí M).
  • Seamless integration with Spectral plugin for precise measurements and labels.
  • Effortless application to selected layers, frames, or entire pages.
  • Tailored for the Koobiq Design System


Plugin Benefits: Empower designers to generate specs that resonate with Koobiq's design language, facilitating a smoother handoff to developers. The plugin streamlines the communication process, ensuring that design intent is conveyed clearly through the use of standardized design tokens.
plugins.tagline: Transforms raw pixel measurements into design token names, such as XS, S, and M

plugins.name: Infinite variable modes
plugins.description:
üÜï support for aliased variables and styles

‚úÖ enjoy infinite variable modes on any Figma plan (even Free)

‚úÖ apply modes to individual layers and sublayers, with native-like experience

‚úÖ reorder variable modes (drag & drop)

‚úÖ manage collections structure (create, rename or remove combined collections, variables and modes)


üé¨ Demo video: https://youtu.be/oBsNb-wuqso?si=sx9yBvkEWSxff9EZ&t=400

(by Raul Marin, it's in Spanish, but it has generated and translated subtitles)


This plugin emulates additional modes available to the user by virtually connecting collections with the same name and structure.

From a user experience standpoint it mimics the native experience as much as possible.


In addition to the basic functionality of virtually connecting the collections and setting an explicit mode to a layer or page, the plugin also offers basic collection structure management features - adding, renaming and deleting modes and variables. These collection management features will display under the explicit modes panel, when there is no layer selected - you work with the whole page (similarly, you can access Local variables in Figma, when no layer is selected).


How it works:


Whenever you need to overcome the limit of modes inside a collection, you open the plugin, choose your collection and add the mode there. The plugin will create another collection with the same name and structure, but inside the plugin it will be one collection with more modes. Add as many modes as you need.


Since there are now multiple collections mimicking one, it could be hard to manage the structure of them - whenever you need to add/remove/rename a variable, you would need to do this in all of the connected collections. Luckily, you can do this inside the plugin, where it acts like one collection seamlessly.


For the plugin to connect the collections together, they need to have the same name and the same structure (if there is no pair for a variable in another collection, it will be indicated by displaying the variable in lighter gray color).


To keep things simple, setting actual values of the variables would happen still in the native Figma Local variables environment, because this is not a redundant work.

To navigate better between collections with the same name, you can add a unique identifier in parenthesis right after the name of the collections. The identification may be for example listing all the modes in that particular collection, or whatever you like, e.g. ‚ÄúMy collection(en, de, es, it)‚Äù and ‚ÄúMy collection(fr, pl, hu, cz)‚Äù etc.


Known limitations:


  1. aliased variables can only point to a non-combined collection. If you'd use combined collection for this purpose, you'd lose the ability to set explicit modes to individual layers


  1. the same as aliased variables goes for variables that are bound to styles


  1. When using bound variables in layout grids and switching from one type to the other (for example from Grid to Columns), always unbind all the variables in the former grid type (Figma Plugin API bug)


  1. Explicit modes badges won‚Äôt display correctly in the layers panel, due to the nature of how the plugin works (connecting multiple collections into one). You need to orient yourself only by what the plugin is showing you. If this turns out as a serious UX issue, I‚Äôll try to figure out an alternative way of displaying explicit modes in layers hierarchy.


  1. If more libraries with the same name will be added to the file, the collections from these libraries will be grouped as if from one library, because current Plugin API doesn‚Äôt include a library id, just a name.


  1. If there is a change made in any of the added libraries while you have your file opened, you need to close the file and open it again to get the library changes. This is an issue with Figma Plugin API, the updated version of the library simply isn‚Äôt available through the API unless the file is reloaded.


  1. There might be some performance issues, especially on older machines, when you have selected layers that contain a lot of sublayers. This is due to the Figma Plugin API, that doesn‚Äôt offer properly working event notifications, and thus the plugin needs to go through every layer and sublayer of the selection to check for bound variables on a periodic basis (in contrary to event-driven basis) which is expensive in terms of performance. The refresh period is set to 1 second, so there might be up to about 1 second delay in refreshing the informations in the plugin, when you change something in the document. If you experience performance issues, deselect all layers when just moving through the document, or run the plugin only when you need to use it and then close it immediately.


  1. Despite my efforts, there still might be some bugs found. If you find any, I would really appreciate if you report them to me. Thank you!


Roadmap:


  1. there will be an option to automatically transfer the data from multiple collections created by this plugin into single collection (in case a user decides to switch to a Figma pricing plan, that offers more modes, or in case Figma changes the pricing model), or vice versa - from single collection into multiple collections (in case user decides to switch to a plan with less modes)


  1. planning a workaround for currently missing support for bound variables in styles

accepted.description: UI/UX, branding, building tools for designers

plugins.tagline: Get rid of the variable modes limit. Theme and localise your designs into oblivion!

132510.name: Infinite variable modes
132510.description:
üÜï support for aliased variables and styles

‚úÖ enjoy infinite variable modes on any Figma plan (even Free)

‚úÖ apply modes to individual layers and sublayers, with native-like experience

‚úÖ reorder variable modes (drag & drop)

‚úÖ manage collections structure (create, rename or remove combined collections, variables and modes)


üé¨ Demo video: https://youtu.be/oBsNb-wuqso?si=sx9yBvkEWSxff9EZ&t=400

(by Raul Marin, it's in Spanish, but it has generated and translated subtitles)


This plugin emulates additional modes available to the user by virtually connecting collections with the same name and structure.

From a user experience standpoint it mimics the native experience as much as possible.


In addition to the basic functionality of virtually connecting the collections and setting an explicit mode to a layer or page, the plugin also offers basic collection structure management features - adding, renaming and deleting modes and variables. These collection management features will display under the explicit modes panel, when there is no layer selected - you work with the whole page (similarly, you can access Local variables in Figma, when no layer is selected).


How it works:


Whenever you need to overcome the limit of modes inside a collection, you open the plugin, choose your collection and add the mode there. The plugin will create another collection with the same name and structure, but inside the plugin it will be one collection with more modes. Add as many modes as you need.


Since there are now multiple collections mimicking one, it could be hard to manage the structure of them - whenever you need to add/remove/rename a variable, you would need to do this in all of the connected collections. Luckily, you can do this inside the plugin, where it acts like one collection seamlessly.


For the plugin to connect the collections together, they need to have the same name and the same structure (if there is no pair for a variable in another collection, it will be indicated by displaying the variable in lighter gray color).


To keep things simple, setting actual values of the variables would happen still in the native Figma Local variables environment, because this is not a redundant work.

To navigate better between collections with the same name, you can add a unique identifier in parenthesis right after the name of the collections. The identification may be for example listing all the modes in that particular collection, or whatever you like, e.g. ‚ÄúMy collection(en, de, es, it)‚Äù and ‚ÄúMy collection(fr, pl, hu, cz)‚Äù etc.


Known limitations:


  1. aliased variables can only point to a non-combined collection. If you'd use combined collection for this purpose, you'd lose the ability to set explicit modes to individual layers


  1. the same as aliased variables goes for variables that are bound to styles


  1. When using bound variables in layout grids and switching from one type to the other (for example from Grid to Columns), always unbind all the variables in the former grid type (Figma Plugin API bug)


  1. Explicit modes badges won‚Äôt display correctly in the layers panel, due to the nature of how the plugin works (connecting multiple collections into one). You need to orient yourself only by what the plugin is showing you. If this turns out as a serious UX issue, I‚Äôll try to figure out an alternative way of displaying explicit modes in layers hierarchy.


  1. If more libraries with the same name will be added to the file, the collections from these libraries will be grouped as if from one library, because current Plugin API doesn‚Äôt include a library id, just a name.


  1. If there is a change made in any of the added libraries while you have your file opened, you need to close the file and open it again to get the library changes. This is an issue with Figma Plugin API, the updated version of the library simply isn‚Äôt available through the API unless the file is reloaded.


  1. There might be some performance issues, especially on older machines, when you have selected layers that contain a lot of sublayers. This is due to the Figma Plugin API, that doesn‚Äôt offer properly working event notifications, and thus the plugin needs to go through every layer and sublayer of the selection to check for bound variables on a periodic basis (in contrary to event-driven basis) which is expensive in terms of performance. The refresh period is set to 1 second, so there might be up to about 1 second delay in refreshing the informations in the plugin, when you change something in the document. If you experience performance issues, deselect all layers when just moving through the document, or run the plugin only when you need to use it and then close it immediately.


  1. Despite my efforts, there still might be some bugs found. If you find any, I would really appreciate if you report them to me. Thank you!


Roadmap:


  1. there will be an option to automatically transfer the data from multiple collections created by this plugin into single collection (in case a user decides to switch to a Figma pricing plan, that offers more modes, or in case Figma changes the pricing model), or vice versa - from single collection into multiple collections (in case user decides to switch to a plan with less modes)


  1. planning a workaround for currently missing support for bound variables in styles
132510.release_notes:
- support for aliased variables and styles (read more in description)
- minor improvments
- bug fixes
132510.tagline: Get rid of the variable modes limit. Theme and localise your designs into oblivion!

plugins.name: Bulk Desaturate: Black & White Image Fills
plugins.description:
Description

Bulk Desaturate makes it easy to convert image fills to black and white in Figma ‚Äî instantly and non-destructively. Whether you're testing tone, removing visual noise, or creating grayscale wireframes, this plugin simplifies your workflow.


How to use

  1. Select images or shapes containing image fills
  2. Choose a style
  3. Convert images


Features

  1. Supports multiple selections
  2. One-click ‚ÄúSelect All‚Äù image fills
  3. Non-destructive fill layering
  4. Optimized grayscale presets
  5. Fast and lightweight ‚Äî ideal for large files


How it works

Bulk Desaturate adds a black and white version of the original image as a new fill layer inside each selected shape. Your original image stays intact underneath, so changes are non-destructive. You can easily remove the grayscale fill by removing this new layer ‚Äî or just press Undo (Ctrl+Z / Cmd+Z) to go back instantly.


Each style (Muted, Neutral, Punchy) applies a different contrast and exposure setting, so you can match the grayscale look to your design‚Äôs mood or testing needs.


Feature requests and feedback

I have plans to make this better and make bulk image editing much easier. While I am working on that, hit me on X (@itssumeetp), via mail (itssumeetp@gmail.com), or leave a comment here.
plugins.tagline: Instantly select all images and convert to black and white. Apply grayscale styles in bulk.

plugins.description:
TypeWise Studio is here to make typography management in Figma easy and efficient. If you‚Äôre tired of digging through layers to find fonts, weights, and sizes, this tool will help you quickly identify and organize all your text styles. Whether you're working solo or in a large team, TypeWise Studio helps you maintain consistency across your designs with minimal effort.


Key Features:


  1. Identify All Font Styles in Your File: Instantly view all fonts, weights, sizes, and and how many times each style is used.
  2. One-Click Style Selection:‚Ä®Select all instances of a font style across your Figma file with a single click. No more hunting down individual layers!
  3. Export a Typography Document:‚Ä®Generate a clean, organized typography document that showcases all your named styles with sample text for easy reference.
  4. Create and Link Figma Styles:‚Ä®With a single click, automatically create Figma styles and link all your text layers to their respective styles for better consistency.
  5. Organize Your Fonts by Usage:‚Ä®Sort and track your fonts based on their frequency of use, making it easier to streamline your typography choices.


Why Use TypeWise Studio?‚Ä®

Keep your typography workflow efficient, organized, and consistent. Whether you‚Äôre building a style guide, preparing a design for handoff, or just cleaning up a messy file, TypeWise Studio makes managing fonts in Figma easier than ever.

plugins.name: NavJam
plugins.description:
NavJam is a versatile navigation and utility plugin for Figma and FigJam, meticulously designed to streamline your workflow and optimize interaction with large boards.


With NavJam, you can tailor your navigation experience with three plugin sizes, ranging from simple back-and-forth navigation to the full power of a dynamic minimap.


Key Features:


Powerful Search: Quickly locate and zoom into specific components or areas of your board.

Dynamic Minimap: Get an overhead view of your entire board and navigate effortlessly with a single click.

Back and Forward Buttons: Easily navigate through your viewing history for quick access to previous focus areas.


NEW! Enhanced QR Code Generator!

Automatically populate QR code text from selected nodes or frames.

Customize with URLs, additional text, sizes, colors, and error correction levels.


NEW Logo Support: Upload and save custom logos to embed directly into your QR codes for future use, making personalization fast and easy.

Save default QR code settings for quicker reuse.

Generate, preview, and add QR codes to your canvas with a single click or double-click.

Even if the QR code isn‚Äôt for Figma/FigJam, NavJam makes generating custom QR codes a breeze for any purpose.


We'd love to hear your feedback and suggestions for new features to make NavJam even more powerful‚Äîlet us know how we can improve your experience!
plugins.tagline: Boost productivity in Figma & FigJam with advanced navigation tools, a minimap, and a search feature

plugins.name: kofferX - Asset Management and Automations
plugins.description:
ü™Ñ tldr:


kofferX streamlines and automates manual tasks such as Dev <> Design Asset Management, Custom Icons and S3 Handling, Token Management, and Review Processes within Figma. Created by designers and developers who understand the pain of manual work, kofferX simplifies collaboration, allowing you to focus on your craft and create amazing products faster.




ü§î What is kofferX?


At kofferX, we eliminate the manual tasks you dread, streamlining asset and token management to enhance your workflow. We understand that handling assets impacts multiple teams, and we're here to simplify those processes for you.


We realize the chores in handling assets and that just doesn't affect one team, but multiple teams:


  1. Design <> Design: Custom icons and illustrations often require frequent asset requests from your team. kofferX simplifies this process.
  2. Dev <> Dev: S3 management and repetitive campaign banner code updates can be tedious. kofferX streamlines these tasks with code and template automation.
  3. Design <> Growth <> Dev: Collaboration becomes trickier with more stakeholders involved. kofferX ensures effective collaboration and integration, keeping everyone in the loop.



‚ö°Ô∏è What all do we offer?


  1. Create Projects and workspaces with access control
  2. Figma to direct S3 uploads to kofferX, just copy link in your favorite format (WEBP, PNG, JPG, SVG)
  3. Get optimized assets with WEBP format conversion on the go.
  4. Create Asset Collections for your campaigns, custom icons, etc.
  5. Plugin Asset Library is a simple drag <> Drop to your fav asset to Figma canvas, whenever you need. (Imagine your own brand library or icon library across teams!)
  6. Replace Assets with new chagnes anytime over the older ones, or restore your past iterations ;)
  7. Compare and review your old to latest asset changes and log them.
  8. Add Tags and keep track of your assets from Plugin/System.



üòé Why kofferX should be a part of your team?


  1. Seamless Integration: kofferX blends effortlessly into your team's existing workflow, staying invisible while enhancing productivity.
  2. Focus on Productivity: Allows your team to use their everyday tools without disruptions, enabling them to work faster and more efficiently. Say no to chores!
  3. Enhanced Collaboration: Eliminates the need for Gdrive, Slack, and WhatsApp, streamlining communication and processes.
  4. Campaign Power: kofferX optimizes your workflows, helping you stay in the loop and power your campaigns effectively.



We are still early and constantly hearing feedback from our users. We are sure kofferX will keep your team pipelines in check without affecting existing codebase or structure. We will soon release our pricing plan and you will love it more as you use. We have something big coming in line for our users and our commitment to it will solve this hassle between teams to improve design -> delivery processes.

For any queries, we are prompt to reply instantly here: dm.new/kofferX


üõ£Ô∏è Roadmap


  1. Design <> Marketing: Design Reviews and Slack Thread is never ending. Managing Google Drive, Whatsapp, Slack to find design_final_final won't be an issue with kofferX.
  2. Design <> Dev: Exporting assets in webp, and S3 cloud, and then back to codebase with asset link is lot of hassle. This pain gets 10x to make changes and update each thing everytime. Token management is painful story for another day, but know this, we directly sync with your Github and no hefty pricing.


and it goes on and on ü¶Ü...


You can know more about us here: www.kofferx.com
plugins.tagline: Automate manual chores like Asset Management, Token Management and Review process!

plugins.name: Mini Map Pro
plugins.description:
Mini Map Pro is a Figma plugin designed to enhance navigation and efficiency when working with large Figma design files. One common challenge designers face is navigating quickly to different parts of a large canvas, especially when dealing with complex projects with numerous frames and elements. Mini Map Pro addresses this issue by automatically generating a mini-map preview of the entire design.


With Mini Map Pro, users can easily view a scaled-down version of their entire Figma design and quickly click to navigate to specific areas. This feature allows designers to move seamlessly across different sections of the design, without having to manually zoom in or scroll through large files. The plugin helps improve productivity and offers a more convenient way to interact with the Figma workspace, making it an essential tool for designers working on extensive projects.


Key Features:

- Auto-Generated Design Preview: Automatically creates a mini-map of the entire Figma canvas, giving users an overview of all design elements.

- Quick Navigation: Click on the mini-map to jump directly to any section of the design, eliminating the need for cumbersome scrolling or zooming.

- Improved Workflow: Enhance your workflow by providing a clear visual context of the design layout, making it easier to locate and edit specific elements.


Use Case:

Imagine working on a complex dashboard UI with dozens of screens and components. Instead of manually searching through each frame, Mini Map Pro lets you see all frames at a glance and quickly navigate to any screen with a single click.


This plugin is ideal for designers looking to streamline their navigation process and focus more on designing rather than managing the canvas.
plugins.tagline: Navigate large Figma files effortlessly auto-generate mini-map previews for quick access

You can also create more interesting patterns if you change total rotation option
